instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
threads.message:
Original issue was no power due to corrosion damaged capacitors, C6405, C6416 and C6482. Once power was restored, the computer boots up and runs fine with or with power adapter plugged in. But whenever the power adapter is plugged in, or power button is pressed to turn on, apple logo comes on then comes up with the black screen crash window saying 

Your computer restarted because of a problem. Press a key or wait
a few seconds to continue starting up

Any suggestion?

threads.title: 820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
threads.message:
Liquid sign on audio board/flex?

"runs fine with or with power adapter plugged in"
Not sure what this means...

threads.title: 820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
threads.message:
No liquid sign on audio board.

And what i mean was that once it's loaded to OS, the computer runs just fine.

threads.title: 820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
threads.message: I saw similar problem solved with DFU...

threads.title: 820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
threads.message: DFU revive didn't do the trick. Should i do a DFU restore which wipes the ssd?

threads.title: 820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
threads.message: DFU restore didn't fix it. Same issue still present

threads.title: 820-01521: Reboots when power is plugged in
threads.message: Must be T2 internal problem then...
